Blind Spot

Blind Spot | A Globe investigation | part 2He was a wrecking machine before the gruesome N.H. crash. Why didn't anyone stop Volodymyr Zhukovskyy?The skinny, fidgety 23-year-old with a penchant for gold chains, fast cars, heroin, and Hennessey, had a long trail of crashes behind him when he was handed the keys to a truck. Any questions about him wouldn’t draw notice for a few more days, when seven people lay dying on a lonely mountain road amid twisted metal and flames.

The lack of Black leaders in New England college sports is ‘what institutional and systemic racism look like’A Globe survey found that only 5 of 112 New England colleges have a Black athletic director and only 2 of 58 football teams have a Black head coach. And when schools have had the opportunity to improve their numbers, they haven't always taken it.

Blind Spot

Blind Spot | A Globe investigation | part 2He was a wrecking machine before the gruesome N.H. crash. Why didn't anyone stop Volodymyr Zhukovskyy?The skinny, fidgety 23-year-old with a penchant for gold chains, fast cars, heroin, and Hennessey, had a long trail of crashes behind him when he was handed the keys to a truck. Any questions about him wouldn’t draw notice for a few more days, when seven people lay dying on a lonely mountain road amid twisted metal and flames.

Blind Spot

Blind Spot | A Globe investigation | part 2He was a wrecking machine before the gruesome N.H. crash. Why didn't anyone stop Volodymyr Zhukovskyy?The skinny, fidgety 23-year-old with a penchant for gold chains, fast cars, heroin, and Hennessey, had a long trail of crashes behind him when he was handed the keys to a truck. Any questions about him wouldn’t draw notice for a few more days, when seven people lay dying on a lonely mountain road amid twisted metal and flames.

Blind Spot

Blind Spot | A Globe investigation | part 2He was a wrecking machine before the gruesome N.H. crash. Why didn't anyone stop Volodymyr Zhukovskyy?The skinny, fidgety 23-year-old with a penchant for gold chains, fast cars, heroin, and Hennessey, had a long trail of crashes behind him when he was handed the keys to a truck. Any questions about him wouldn’t draw notice for a few more days, when seven people lay dying on a lonely mountain road amid twisted metal and flames.

Blind Spot

Blind Spot | A Globe investigation | part 2He was a wrecking machine before the gruesome N.H. crash. Why didn't anyone stop Volodymyr Zhukovskyy?The skinny, fidgety 23-year-old with a penchant for gold chains, fast cars, heroin, and Hennessey, had a long trail of crashes behind him when he was handed the keys to a truck. Any questions about him wouldn’t draw notice for a few more days, when seven people lay dying on a lonely mountain road amid twisted metal and flames.

Blind Spot

Blind Spot | A Globe investigation | part 2He was a wrecking machine before the gruesome N.H. crash. Why didn't anyone stop Volodymyr Zhukovskyy?The skinny, fidgety 23-year-old with a penchant for gold chains, fast cars, heroin, and Hennessey, had a long trail of crashes behind him when he was handed the keys to a truck. Any questions about him wouldn’t draw notice for a few more days, when seven people lay dying on a lonely mountain road amid twisted metal and flames.

Blind Spot | A Globe investigation | part 2He was a wrecking machine before the gruesome N.H. crash. Why didn't anyone stop Volodymyr Zhukovskyy?A tragic crash last summer not only claimed the lives of seven people — it also exposed how the Massachusetts Registry of Motor Vehicles failed for years to sideline dangerous drivers. But the failures at motor vehicle agencies here and across the nation run much broader and deeper than that one horrific accident.

Blind Spot

Blind Spot | A Globe investigation | part 2He was a wrecking machine before the gruesome N.H. crash. Why didn't anyone stop Volodymyr Zhukovskyy?A tragic crash last summer not only claimed the lives of seven people — it also exposed how the Massachusetts Registry of Motor Vehicles failed for years to sideline dangerous drivers. But the failures at motor vehicle agencies here and across the nation run much broader and deeper than that one horrific accident.
Read Part 2 now ⟶
Watch the documentary short
Read Part 1 ⟶Dangerous drivers should have lost their licenses. They didn’t — and others died.
Read Part 2 ⟶Questions about Zhukovskyy came too late, after seven people lay dying on a lonely mountain road.

Blind Spot

Blind Spot | A Globe investigation | part 2He was a wrecking machine before the gruesome N.H. crash. Why didn't anyone stop Volodymyr Zhukovskyy?A tragic crash last summer not only claimed the lives of seven people — it also exposed how the Massachusetts Registry of Motor Vehicles failed for years to sideline dangerous drivers. But the failures at motor vehicle agencies here and across the nation run much broader and deeper than that one horrific accident.
Read Part 2 now ⟶
Watch the documentary short

Read Part 2 ⟶Questions about Zhukovskyy came too late, after seven people lay dying on a lonely mountain road.

Blind Spot

Blind Spot | A Globe investigation | part 2He was a wrecking machine before the gruesome N.H. crash. Why didn't anyone stop Volodymyr Zhukovskyy?A tragic crash last summer not only claimed the lives of seven people — it also exposed how the Massachusetts Registry of Motor Vehicles failed for years to sideline dangerous drivers. But the failures at motor vehicle agencies here and across the nation run much broader and deeper than that one horrific accident.
Read Part 2 now ⟶
Watch the documentary short

Blind Spot | A Globe investigation | part 2He was a wrecking machine before the gruesome N.H. crash. Why didn't anyone stop Volodymyr Zhukovskyy?A tragic crash last summer not only claimed the lives of seven people — it also exposed how the Massachusetts Registry of Motor Vehicles failed for years to sideline dangerous drivers. But the failures at motor vehicle agencies here and across the nation run much broader and deeper than that one horrific accident.
Read Part 2 now ⟶
Watch the documentary short
Read Part 1 ⟶Dangerous drivers should have lost their licenses. They didn’t — and others died.
Read Part 2 ⟶Questions about Zhukovskyy came too late, after seven people lay dying on a lonely mountain road.

Blind Spot | A Globe investigation | part 2He was a wrecking machine before the gruesome N.H. crash. Why didn't anyone stop Volodymyr Zhukovskyy?A tragic crash last summer not only claimed the lives of seven people — it also exposed how the Massachusetts Registry of Motor Vehicles failed for years to sideline dangerous drivers. But the failures at motor vehicle agencies here and across the nation run much broader and deeper than that one horrific accident.
Read Part 2 now ⟶
Watch the documentary short
Read Part 1 ⟶Dangerous drivers should have lost their licenses. They didn’t — and others died.
Read Part 2 ⟶Questions about Zhukovskyy came too late, after seven people lay dying on a lonely mountain road.

The lack of Black leaders in New England college sports is ‘what institutional and systemic racism look like’A Globe survey found that only 5 of 112 New England colleges have a Black athletic director and only 2 of 58 football teams have a Black head coach.
